title: Welcome To My Blog
text: Welcome to Sunday Sermons, a blog where I share and reflect on the powerful messages delivered each week at Life Celebration Ministries. My goal is to bring the key insights, biblical teachings, and transformative lessons from our Sunday services to a broader audience, offering a space to meditate on God’s Word throughout the week.

title: Fasting
text:
Choice of the time if the day makes the day binding. Talk to God about the day you have chosen to pray and fast. God does not want us to fast by default. It must be intentional.
Ask Him for grace for fasting. Submit to God and receive the grace.
As Him for the strength to fast. Trust Him to help you concentrate on fasting.
You choice influences such. Without the choice, you cant reach the desired point.
It brings to it seriousness in your mind.
The day you fast is the day acceptable to the Lord.
Fasting is a righteous act. Some regular things should be.
Limit regular activities so you may concentrate on the fasting.
The goal of fasting is to be intimate with God. A time be heard on high. When you fast you seek to be heard high
up there. We fast to increase our chances to be heard.
Effective fasting depends on your lifestyle.
There is how we must live before we fast. Our effectivity in fasting largely depends on how we live.
The foundation of fasting is our lifestyle.
If we live carelessly and begin to fast we just give basis for satan.
Before we fast lets live to honour to God. God will not listen to us when we pray but ignore social justice

title: About
text:
Welcome to Sunday Sermons, a blog where I share and reflect on the powerful messages delivered each week at Life Celebration Ministries. My goal is to bring the key insights, biblical teachings, and transformative lessons from our Sunday services to a broader audience, offering a space to meditate on God’s Word throughout the week.


At Life Celebration Ministries, Sunday sermons are a vital source of spiritual guidance, offering us a chance to connect with God’s wisdom and purpose. This blog seeks to extend the reach of these sermons beyond the church walls, helping us apply the messages to our daily lives.
I feel a deep responsibility to share the lessons and insights that impact me from each service. This space is dedicated to summarizing and reflecting on the sermons we hear at church, so that we can revisit the messages and allow them to resonate in our hearts throughout the week.

title: Fight The Good Fight
text:
1 Timothy 6:11-12, Ephesians 6:10-12
But you, man of God flee from all this …
Be strong in the Lord and the power of His might.
There is need for us to understand the good fight. There is good fight going on in the world today. Do you know the good fight?
There is a fight for whihc
God gives His divine power. Are you involved in the fight? God wants us to be involved in the good fight.
His divine power is given from heavne on the heart of every beliver so they may fight the good fight.
Understand what God is fighting for.
We dont do well in the good fight when we dont understand what God is fighting for
When we understand what God is fightng for we fight with a purpose. Then God’s objective becomes our motivation.
We must be keen to understand that among other things why God is fighting the good fight. So that our view of the fight is not just about some incidence.
Every beliver is in the good fight. We must be fighting a long side God. He wants to train us to fight.
God trained him to fight the good fight. Psalms 118
We must understand the good
God is fighting for no other reason other than that which HE sent Jesus to accomplish here on the earth.
Luke 19:10 - The son of man came to seek and save that which was lost.
He came to change peoples heart so seriously that the change becomes visible in their conduct. He came to transform those who are regarded as bad in the society.
All our good men and women need salvation.
All our bad men and women need salvation.
Salvation is transformation of ones heart. It is a changed heart.
Everyone is short of the glory of the Lord.
Salvation is the deliverance from the power of sin.
God is fighting to save individual souls
We must take our part in that fight.
